radiographic_examinations.findings: Thickening of the long bones and skull, consistent with suspected Caffey’s disease (infantile cortical hyperostosis); demineralized, broadened femur.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Demineralized, broadened bones with a coarse trabecular pattern; progressive bowing deformities occurred, especially in the lower extremities. Treatment with bisphosphonates resulted in improved mineralization, but bowing deformities were progressive.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Bowing of femur and tibia; radiographs demonstrated severe coxa vara with Shepherd’s crook deformity of the proximal femur.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Pathological fracture of the left tibia occurred; despite treatment with bisphosphonates, progress in bone disease was observed.
